<p>Soon after they settled in the Mines of Moria, the Orcs wanted to install a video surveillance system. The Mines of Moria are simple: they are straigh-line tunnels connecting crossings. There is at most one path to go from one crossing to another.</p>
<p>The Orcs want to install cameras at crossings. A camera can watch over the crossing where it sits, but also the crossings next to it, that is separated by one tunnel.</p>
<p><em>Find the smallest number of cameras that the Orcs need to watch over all the crossings.</em></p>
<p>We don’t know precisely, but here is what the Mines of Moria may look like. The crossings are numbered from 1 to 10. The node 0 represents the outside world and need not be covered by a camera. In this example, it is possible to watch over all the crossings with only three cameras.</p>
<p><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," alt=""></p>
<h3 id="input">Input</h3>
<p>The inputs that with an integer <span class="math inline"><em>T</em></span> (<span class="math inline">1 ≤ <em>T</em> ≤ 1000</span>), the number of test cases. Then follows <span class="math inline"><em>T</em></span> lines, one for each test case.</p>
<p>Each test case start with an integer <span class="math inline"><em>N</em></span> (<span class="math inline">1 ≤ <em>N</em> ≤ 10<sup>6</sup></span>), the number of crossings. Then <span class="math inline"><em>N</em></span> integers <span class="math inline"><em>a</em><sub>1</sub>, …, <em>a</em><sub><em>N</em></sub></span> follow, where <span class="math inline"><em>a</em><sub><em>i</em></sub></span> is the crossing next to the crossing <span class="math inline"><em>i</em></span> that when going towards the outside. The integer <span class="math inline"><em>a</em><sub><em>i</em></sub></span> is zero if <span class="math inline"><em>a</em><sub><em>i</em></sub></span> is directly connected to the outside.</p>
<p>The depth of the tree is at most <span class="math inline">10<sup>4</sup></span>.</p>
<h3 id="output">Output</h3>
<p>For each test case, output the cardinality of the smallest subset <span class="math inline"><em>S</em></span> of the crossings such that each crossing is in <span class="math inline"><em>S</em></span> or adjacent to a crossing in <span class="math inline"><em>S</em></span>.</p>
<h3 id="example">Example</h3>
<pre><strong>input:</strong>
3
3 0 0 0
3 0 1 2
10 2 0 2 5 8 5 8 0 7 9

<strong>output:</strong>
3
1
3
</pre>
